title: Should Veterans Day and Memorial Day be combined to one holiday?

content: NO!!! each holiday has it's purpose. Sometimes more lately than before, they get confused. Memorial Day is just that, rememberance of those that fell in wars. Veterans Day is for all those who put the uniform on and served in war and peace. I do not consider myself to be honored for my service on Memorial Day, it is the day I honor all those that did not have the life I had. Memorial Day is their day, Veteran's Day is ours.
reply: NO!!! each holiday has it's purpose. Sometimes more lately than before, they get confused. Memorial Day is just that, rememberance of those that fell in wars. content: Considering fewer activities attend either ..as in the past...perhaps one would insure that ALL employers and the Governement observe it by observing one? Comments?

title: Should Veterans Day and Memorial Day be combined to one holiday?

content: quote: Originally posted by strobelvets: Considering fewer activities attend either ..as in the past...perhaps one would insure that ALL employers and the Governement observe it by observing one? Comments? They are both Federal Holidays and time off is given for anyone to honor the fallen and the uniformed. Can't make people do what they should but because of our latest wars showing the mistakes rendered to the fallen and uniformed in the past, I have seen an upsurge in service attendence. As for civvie businesses operating as usual well........they are civvies after all and the almighty buck is their god.

title: Should Veterans Day and Memorial Day be combined to one holiday?

content: Sure and next we can combine 4th of July and Columbus Day. No not really, Signal said most of it already. Each day has its own purpose. When Memorial Day comes around we visit as many family graves as weather allows. With our research of the two geneologies this now at 6 cemetaries. On Veterans Day I go back to Grandpa's(WWI) and Father-in-law's(WWII) graves. I then have breakfast with my Father(Korea) and Uncles(WWII) and this last year when I came home from brunch my step children had a card and some cupcakes for me (Beer HallsCold War).
reply: Sure and next we can combine 4th of July and Columbus Day. No not really, Signal said most of it already. Each day has its own purpose. title: Should Veterans Day and Memorial Day be combined to one holiday?

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I hope they never get rid of Veterans day. Thats the one day I can always get 10% off on big ticket items at most stores. Doubt it duster, Memorial Day originated from Decoration Day back in the 1880s when flowers were put on Union graves. The South had their own day but when it change to Memorial Day, it then combined the WWI dead, it became the national day for rememberence.. Veteran's Day originated from Rememberence Day, Nov 11 1918. Most allied countries use that day for their Memorial Day as they call Rememberence Day. Since we already had May 30, originally, we turned Nov 11th into Vet's Day, signed into law by Eisenhower. I think both are here to stay...as is. BTW, I bought my poppy today.
quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I hope they never get rid of Veterans day. Thats the one day I can always get 10% off on big ticket items at most stores.
reply: Doubt it duster, Memorial Day originated from Decoration Day back in the 1880s when flowers were put on Union graves. The South had their own day but when it change to Memorial Day, it then combined the WWI dead, it became the national day for rememberence.. Veteran's Day originated from Rememberence Day, Nov 11 1918. Most allied countries use that day for their Memorial Day as they call Rememberence Day. Since we already had May 30, originally, we turned Nov 11th into Vet's Day, signed into law by Eisenhower. I think both are here to stay...as is. BTW, I bought my poppy today.

content: quote: Originally posted by SignalSgtWilliams: NO!!! each holiday has it's purpose. Sometimes more lately than before, they get confused. Memorial Day is just that, rememberance of those that fell in wars. Veterans Day is for all those who put the uniform on and served in war and peace. I do not consider myself to be honored for my service on Memorial Day, it is the day I honor all those that did not have the life I had. Memorial Day is their day, Veteran's Day is ours. Sgt Williams echoes the sentiments of all...and frankly...my sentiments... Sad that few have option to attend Veterans Day but mostly government workers who nowadays are mostly non-vets...Memorial Days fallin on weekends and such...are more accessible...for most of us...

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I hope they never get rid of Veterans day. Thats the one day I can always get 10% off on big ticket items at most stores. Doubt it duster, Memorial Day originated from Decoration Day back in the 1880s when flowers were put on Union graves. The South had their own day but when it change to Memorial Day, it then combined the WWI dead, it became the national day for rememberence.. Veteran's Day originated from Rememberence Day, Nov 11 1918. Most allied countries use that day for their Memorial Day as they call Rememberence Day. Since we already had May 30, originally, we turned Nov 11th into Vet's Day, signed into law by Eisenhower. I think both are here to stay...as is. BTW, I bought my poppy today.
quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I hope they never get rid of Veterans day. Thats the one day I can always get 10% off on big ticket items at most stores.

Veteran's Day originated from Rememberence Day, Nov 11 1918. Most allied countries use that day for their Memorial Day as they call Rememberence Day. Since we already had May 30, originally, we turned Nov 11th into Vet's Day, signed into law by Eisenhower. I think both are here to stay...as is. BTW, I bought my poppy today.

content: No. Memorial day is a day to remember those that have already past. Veterans day is a Day to celebrate and say thank you to all veterans living and dead. Plus all those people who get those extra days off would throw a fit. Not that I get those days off but come on do you think everyone would let that happen.

Plus all those people who get those extra days off would throw a fit. Not that I get those days off but come on do you think everyone would let that happen.
